adviseScripts.text: Commander, do you like your food sweet?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Or do you prefer it salty?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Both.
Neither.
Hey now, you should know how bad that is for your health!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I guess I'll have to give you an extra thorough checkup, right now!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Oh, really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I didn't realize you were so health-conscious.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If you had said you liked both, I was going to give you a checkup right here.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Too bad...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I learn more from Mary about the correlation between food and health.
Commander, would you rather be very ill for a short period of time...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: ... or be just a little sick for a long time?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Option 1.
Option 2.
Just as I thought!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I figured you would say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: After all, you're always being so reckless on missions and getting yourself hurt.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: The syringe I prepared for you is perfect, then. It'll hurt for a little bit, but then you'll be as good as new.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Oh, is that so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hm... I'm not sure what to do, then. The syringe I prepared is the other way around.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Oh well. There's no other way!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I guess you'll just have to take it anyway...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I persuade Mary into not giving me a shot.
Commander, do you always try to hold onto all of your memories?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Even the bad ones?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Yes.
No.
You do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: For a Commander in this day and age,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: it would be far better to have a poor memory.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text:
If you ever have a bad memory that just won't go away,
come and find me. Okay?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm glad to hear that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It's probably ideal for a Commander to not linger on their memories too long.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Sometimes war can give us positive memories, but most of them are traumatic.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I spend some meaningful time with Mary.
Commander!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I have a patient who doesn't take care of themselves.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: They even refuse to take the medicine I prescribe for them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What should I do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Sorry. From now on, I'll do whatever you say.
Give them a painful shot.
Ha ha! So, you knew the patient I was talking about is you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What a shame.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If you hadn't figured it out, I was going to give you a painful shot.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Can I really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Well then, dear patient, you better buckle up, because this one is gonna hurt!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hey! Where are you going?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Mary while fighting the instinct to run away.
Commander, what should I do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Every time I see Pepper, I just get so excited!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Let me guess. You've found something to tease her about.
Does Pepper owe you money or something?
I knew you'd catch on quick!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Pepper is so adorable. She made a little mistake in the hospital.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I've been going to the hospital the past few days to tease her about it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: No, although I wouldn't mind a little extra spending money.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It's just that, every time I see her, all I want to do is tease her!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I speak with Mary about her opinion of Pepper.
Pepper keeps asking what she needs to do to be like me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: How should I respond to that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Tell her to be more of a buzzkill.
Tell her to keep her eyes half-closed all the time.
Ha! Ha! Oh, Commander!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Do you really think I'm a buzzkill?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You're such a silly goose!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Good idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll make sure she does it, too.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I have a fun time with Mary.
Hm... While I was walking through the Outpost,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I saw lots of people who should come to the hospital, but they haven't.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Why are they all avoiding coming to the hospital?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: They're scared of you.
They're scared of the hospital.
Am I really that bad?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Ha ha, I'm afraid I don't have the slightest idea what you mean, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hee hee hee hee...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hm. The hospital is typically somewhere you only go when you're sick.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That can be scary for some people.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Maybe that's why so many people avoid going.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I spend some time with Mary sharing scary hospital stories.
I'm always used to having to listen to others talk, so I really enjoy it when I can talk to you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: It puts my mind at ease and my worries all just melt away.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But, Commander... don't you ever want other people to listen to what's on your mind?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I do.
I don't.
How about you tell me what's on your mind next time?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Maybe that way I can find a way to help you relax.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Come to me any time you want to talk. Really.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That's a normal reaction.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Well, if you ever want to talk about anything that's bothering you,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text:
just come find me.
I'll always make myself available for you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: The time I spent with Mary was very meaningful.
You know, Commander...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Pepper really thinks I'm a good person.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I feel bad about that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm not a good person. Not really.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That's for Pepper to decide.
In my eyes, you're good enough.
That's true.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I suppose it is her right to make her own decision about me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Thank you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Commander, the way you look at me... it makes me feel... nice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Thank you, hee hee.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I have a heart-to-heart talk with Mary.
Hm, a thought just came to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If I wasn't a doctor, what would I be doing instead?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Jabbing people with needles for free?
A nurse?
Ha ha! Is that what you think of me, Commander?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm afraid that's incorrect.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I wouldn't want to be doing a job that only inflicts pain on others.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If not a doctor, then a nurse!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: So you think no matter what happens, I'll always be there with a syringe in my hand, is that it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I... I suppose that's true.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: No matter what, I'd almost certainly end up in the medical field.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: A job where I inflict pain, yes, but also where I help others at the same time.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: There's only one field that fits this description.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I have a fun time thinking about other jobs Mary would do.
I've been thinking about redecorating the rooms for our long-term patients, giving them some pizzazz.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If you have any good ideas, feel free to share.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: How about we place some flowers?
Let's put in a video game system.
Hmm...the only thing is that it's very difficult to find any fresh flowers in the Ark.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But if you're able to bring some back from up on the surface, then
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I think the patients would be very happy. I'd appreciate it as well, hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Are you sure that's not just what you want?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: On top of that, not every patient is in the condition to be gaming.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I brainstormed about ways to decorate the hospital rooms.
What do you think is the most sought-after trait for a doctor?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Feeling compassion for their patients, or distancing themselves from the patients?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Compassion for the patients.
Distancing themselves from the patients.
I expected you would say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: However...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If you empathize too deeply with your patients,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: it could be traumatic, and you'll end up becoming an empty shell.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: This isn't only a problem for doctors.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Oh my! I thought you would say the opposite.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm surprised that you responded rationally. Hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: In that case, it would be wise to maintain a certain mental distance from the Nikkes whom you are counseling. Understood?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: As it turned out, I was the one who received counseling from Mary.
We've been having a lot of patients who have been exaggerating their symptoms.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hooting and hollering about being scared of shots, even crying.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: How on earth am I supposed to administer a shot to these people?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Flash them a big smile.
Distract them by talking about something else, then give them a stealthy jab.
I'm not sure about that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Seeing a nurse with a syringe in her hand and a deranged smile on her face
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: will only freak outpatients more.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That's a wonderful idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Searching for the right moment to sneak it in sounds like fun too.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Heehee.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I talk about the proper mindset to have before administering a shot.
We're preparing a small event for our patients at the hospital.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I can't decide between a concert by the Tetra Nikkes, or having the medical staff do some cosplay.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What do you think the patients would get a bigger kick out of?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Cosplay.
Concert.
Hehe, good choice! Actually, I'm a big fan of cosplay.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Besides, Pepper is already practically a celebrity amongst the patients,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: so there's no need to bring in famous Nikkes from outside.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm sure the younger patients would appreciate that more.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: They all have pictures of either Epinel or Noise.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I talk about the event to be held at the hospital.
A new season has already arrived. Time goes by so fast.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: By the way, are you sure you're not forgetting something?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I don't think so...
A checkup?
Strange...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'm positive I sent everyone a reminder to get a checkup done.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Yet you're the only one who apparently isn't aware of it!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, bingo!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I can't emphasize enough just how important it is to get checks ups done regularly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: With that being said, I'll pencil you in.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary continued to lecture me about the importance of getting regular checkups.
We've had a lot of disputes and disagreements amongst the patients.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: And the reasons are varied, such as because the manufacture is different, or the relationship was not good when they were human...
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Anything I can do to help?
Even when you're around?
Oh, don't worry! You're doing plenty already.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You're listening to me vent, hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Hehe, of course not!
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: If they pulled that when I was around,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I would make it more painful when giving them their shots.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary shared the difficulties of hospital life with me.
Commander, how do you feel about white lies?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I think they can be a good thing.
I'm completely against it.
I agree completely.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Telling the truth isn't always the best course of action.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Especially if the truth could be hurtful to the person hearing it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Yes, I figured that's how you'd feel.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: However, some people may just blurt out a painful truth
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: simply because they're looking to be forgiven, and that's all.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I have a meaningful conversation.
I recently had a Nikke patient ask me
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: why I still work as a doctor when I'm a Nikke.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: And? Why do you think that is?
This is your calling. You don't owe anyone an explanation.
Atonement.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: That sounds a bit pretentious, doesn't it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: In the past, I wanted to help people in any way I could, and I still do now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: You hit the nail on the head.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll be sure to tell that to the next person who asks me the same question.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I speak with Mary about the mindset necessary to be a doctor.
We've recently had an influx of patients with peculiar symptoms.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: They all ate the same food and ended up collapsing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: What kind of food was it?
Do you have any suspects?
I can't really be sure what it is, but
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I believe ingredients were used that shouldn't be mixed together.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: They also apparently burnt it to a crisp...honestly, you couldn't make a nastier dish if you tried.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I do have my eye on one Nikke in particular.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: She rarely comes to the hospital,
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: so we didn't have any opportunities to teach her about proper cooking methods.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary vented about the culinary catastrophe.
Medical staff always have to put on a happy face when they're in front of patients.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: But I'm not sure I agree with that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Who's to say how someone should act in front of others?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: On that note, what traits do you look for in a person, Commander?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Selflessness
Being down-to-earth.
So... someone who thinks about others more than themselves?
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I suppose a lot of people find that admirable.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Wow, your standards are a bit different compared to other people.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Nevertheless, I appreciate your honesty.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: I'll try and be more true to myself when treating you as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Mary

adviseScripts.text: Mary and I talk about what makes an ideal medical professional.
